weeks.title: Week 1: Profile, LinkedIn & STAR Stories Foundation
weeks.description: Build strong career foundation: optimize resume, establish LinkedIn presence, develop 10+ STAR stories
goals: Optimize resume with quantified impact statements
Build compelling LinkedIn profile with network connections
Develop 10+ STAR stories covering all behavioral dimensions
Set up job search infrastructure and tracking

days.title: Resume Audit & Optimization
days.description: Review resume against FAANG examples, add quantified metrics

tasks.title: Review Resume Against FAANG Examples
tasks.description: Study top resumes from Blind, Levels.fyi, GitHub

tasks.title: Rewrite Bullet Points with Metrics
tasks.description: Add quantified achievements: % improvement, revenue impact, scale metrics
tasks.notes: Target 5-7 bullets. Use: Reduced, Optimized, Architected, Led, Scaled

tasks.title: Update Projects Section
tasks.description: Add 2-3 flagship projects with GitHub links and technical depth
tasks.notes: Include: tech stack, impact, link to GitHub

days.title: LinkedIn Deep Dive & Network Building
days.description: Build professional LinkedIn presence and initial network

tasks.title: Setup LinkedIn Profile
tasks.description: Profile picture, headline, summary, current role, skills
tasks.notes: Headline format: Software Engineer | {Languages} | Seeking {Roles} in {Locations}

tasks.title: Write Compelling Summary
tasks.description: 150-200 word summary highlighting technical depth and career goals

tasks.title: Add Skills & Endorsements
tasks.description: List all relevant skills (Python, Java, AWS, Docker, etc.)

tasks.title: Connect with 30+ Engineers at Target Companies
tasks.description: Find and send personalized connection requests
tasks.notes: Mention something specific about their work in message

days.title: STAR Stories Brainstorm & Framework
days.description: Identify and categorize career stories

tasks.title: Brainstorm 20 Career Achievements
tasks.description: List all major accomplishments, projects, and learning moments
tasks.notes: Include: leadership, technical excellence, conflict resolution, failure & learning, impact

tasks.title: Categorize into STAR Dimensions
tasks.description: Organize 10 best stories into categories: Leadership, Technical, Conflict, Failure, Impact
tasks.notes: Target 2-3 stories per category

tasks.title: Write First STAR Story (Leadership)
tasks.description: Situation, Task, Action, Result format — 1.5-2 min delivery
tasks.notes: Action should be 3-4 sentences on what YOU did. Quantify results.

days.title: STAR Stories Development & Practice
days.description: Develop additional stories and practice delivery

tasks.title: Write Fourth STAR Story (Failure & Learning)
tasks.description: What you learned from a setback

tasks.title: Write Fifth STAR Story (Impact & Results)
tasks.description: Major project or initiative with clear outcomes

tasks.title: Practice Delivering All 5 Stories Aloud
tasks.description: Practice timing, pacing, clarity. Aim for natural, confident delivery.
tasks.notes: Record yourself. Listen for filler words, pacing issues.

days.title: STAR Refinement & Additional Stories
days.description: Polish stories and develop remaining ones

tasks.title: Write Additional STAR Stories (5-10)
tasks.description: Fill out remaining dimensions: diverse experiences, different contexts
tasks.notes: Aim for 10+ total stories covering all behavioral competencies

tasks.title: Record All Stories
tasks.description: Record yourself telling each story (video or audio)
tasks.notes: Play back and note: pacing, clarity, enthusiasm, natural flow

tasks.title: Prepare Answers to Common Questions
tasks.description: Why this company? Where do you see yourself? Weaknesses?

days.title: LinkedIn Polish & Job Search Setup
days.description: Finalize LinkedIn and set up application infrastructure

tasks.title: Get LinkedIn Feedback & Polish
tasks.description: Share with 2-3 trusted friends, implement feedback

tasks.title: Create Target Company List (Top 50)
tasks.description: Research and compile list of dream companies with salary data
tasks.notes: Use: Blind, Levels.fyi, company websites for scale/culture

tasks.title: Setup Job Application Tracker
tasks.description: Create spreadsheet: company, role, date applied, response status, notes

days.title: Week 1 Review & Application Blitz
days.description: Finalize preparation and submit first applications

tasks.title: Final Resume Polish & Review
tasks.description: Get feedback from 3+ people. Check for typos, formatting consistency.
tasks.notes: Resume is your first impression — make it perfect

tasks.title: STAR Stories Final Run-Through
tasks.description: Practice with a friend. Get feedback on delivery.

tasks.title: Submit First 5 Applications
tasks.description: Customize resume + cover letter. Target 'warm-up' companies.
tasks.notes: Pick companies you'd genuinely be happy with

weeks.title: Week 2: Arrays & Strings Deep Dive
weeks.description: Master fundamental array and string algorithms with 20+ problems
goals: Solve 20+ array and string problems (easy to medium focus)
Understand two-pointers, sliding window, hash maps
Build pattern recognition for common variations

days.title: Two Pointers & Basic Arrays
days.description: Fundamental two-pointer patterns on arrays

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #88 (Merge Sorted Array)
tasks.keyTakeaway: Three pointers from end (avoid extra space)

days.title: More Array Patterns
days.description: Single pass, tracking min/max patterns

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #121 (Best Time to Buy Stock)
Solve LeetCode #238 (Product of Array Except Self)

days.title: Strings & Sliding Window Intro
days.description: String problems and sliding window foundation

days.title: Advanced Sliding Window
days.description: Complex sliding window problems

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #438 (Find All Anagrams in a String)

days.title: More Strings & Array Mastery
days.description: Additional string patterns and array variations

days.title: Linked Lists Intro
days.description: Introduction to linked list problems

days.title: Week 2 Review & Coding Sprint
days.description: Practice and review week 2 problems

tasks.title: Redo 5 Hardest Problems from Scratch
tasks.description: No looking at solutions. Time yourself.
tasks.notes: Aim for <5 min each for easy, <15 min for medium

tasks.title: Review Key Patterns
tasks.description: Summarize: two pointers, sliding window, hash maps
tasks.notes: Identify which pattern applies to different problem types

weeks.title: Week 3: Trees & Graphs Fundamentals
weeks.description: Master tree and graph algorithms with DFS/BFS patterns (20+ problems)
goals: Master DFS, BFS, and recursion patterns

days.title: Tree Fundamentals & DFS
days.description: Basic tree problems and DFS recursion

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #104 (Maximum Depth of Binary Tree)

days.title: BFS & Level Order Traversal
days.description: Queue-based tree traversal

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #102 (Binary Tree Level Order Traversal)
Solve LeetCode #111 (Minimum Depth of Binary Tree)

days.title: Tree Property Validation
days.description: Validating tree properties

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #98 (Validate Binary Search Tree)
tasks.description: Tree property validation with min/max tracking

days.title: Graph Basics & DFS
days.description: Introduction to graph problems using DFS

days.title: Graph Algorithms & Cycles
days.description: Topological sort and cycle detection

days.title: More Tree Problems
days.description: Advanced tree manipulation and path problems

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #235 (Lowest Common Ancestor of BST)

days.title: Week 3 Review & Graph/Tree Sprint
days.description: Practice and consolidate week 3 concepts

tasks.title: Redo 7 Hardest Problems from Scratch
tasks.description: Mix of trees and graphs. No solutions.
tasks.notes: Identify DFS vs BFS patterns. When do you use each?

tasks.title: Study Pattern: Tree Recursion vs Iteration

weeks.title: Week 4: More Graphs & DP Introduction
weeks.description: Advanced graph problems and dynamic programming intro (20+ problems)
goals: Understand DP concepts and simple DP problems

days.title: More Graph Traversal
days.description: Advanced graph traversal and path problems

days.title: Dynamic Programming Intro
days.description: Simple DP problems and concepts

days.title: Backtracking Intro
days.description: Backtracking pattern and basic problems

days.title: More Backtracking
days.description: Complex backtracking problems

days.title: Heaps Introduction
days.description: Heap data structure and basic problems

days.title: More DP Problems
days.description: Additional DP problems on different domains

days.title: Week 4 Review & Consolidation
days.description: Review and consolidate week 4 concepts

tasks.title: Redo 7 Hardest Problems from Week 4
tasks.description: Mix of graphs, DP, backtracking. No solutions.
tasks.notes: Identify when to use: graph traversal, DP, backtracking

tasks.title: Study Guide: DP Patterns
tasks.description: Summarize DP approach: define state, base cases, recurrence

weeks.title: Week 5: Advanced DP, Greedy & System Design Intro
weeks.description: Complex DP problems, greedy algorithms, and system design foundations (20+ problems)

days.title: Advanced DP: 2D Problems
days.description: Complex 2D dynamic programming

days.title: Greedy Algorithms
days.description: Greedy optimization patterns

days.title: System Design Fundamentals
days.description: Learn system design basics + first case study

tasks.title: Study System Design Basics
tasks.description: Scalability, latency, throughput, load balancing, caching, databases

tasks.title: Learn Design Twitter (Case Study 1)
tasks.notes: Watch 30-45 min detailed explanation

days.title: More DP & Second System Design
days.description: More complex DP and system design case study

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #188 (Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock IV)
Learn Design Uber (Case Study 2)
tasks.description: Real-time matching, location tracking, payments, scalability

days.title: DP Mixed Problems & System Design Practice
days.description: Variety of DP problems and design practice

tasks.title: Solve 5 Random DP Problems
tasks.description: Mixed difficulty and domains. Build speed and pattern recognition.
tasks.notes: Pick from: stock, knapsack, string, grid, game theory domains

tasks.title: Sketch System Design: Design Instagram
tasks.description: Feed generation, posts, likes, notifications, scalability
tasks.notes: Sketch your solution before watching reference

days.title: System Design Deep Dive (Case Study 3)
days.description: Third system design and advanced DP review

tasks.title: Learn Design Netflix
tasks.description: Video streaming, transcoding, CDN, recommendations, bitrate adaptation

days.title: Week 5 Review & Interview Readiness
days.description: Week 5 review and start interview preparation

tasks.title: Redo 8 DP + Greedy Problems from Scratch
tasks.description: Mix of all topics. Test speed and understanding.
tasks.notes: Aim to solve faster than Day 1

tasks.title: Review 3 System Designs
tasks.description: Sketch each design from memory before reviewing notes
tasks.notes: Focus on: features, data model, API, scalability, trade-offs

tasks.title: Submit 3 Applications + Interview Prep
tasks.description: Applications + research companies with upcoming interviews
tasks.notes: You're interview-ready! Start scheduling.

weeks.title: Week 6: System Design Deep Dive & Advanced Topics
weeks.description: Master system design + advanced algorithms (Tries, Union-Find, Advanced DP)

days.title: Trie Data Structure
days.description: Trie fundamentals and applications

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #211 (Design Add and Search Words)

days.title: Union-Find Data Structure
days.description: Union-Find (Disjoint Set Union) problems

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #684 (Redundant Connection)
tasks.description: Union-Find to detect cycle in undirected graph

days.title: Interval Problems & System Design Case Study 4
days.description: Interval algorithms and fourth system design

tasks.title: Learn Design Dropbox
tasks.description: File upload, sync, sharing, versioning, CDN, database sharding
tasks.notes: Focus on: file chunking, deduplication, sync conflicts

days.title: Advanced Heaps & Case Study 5
days.description: Complex heap problems and system design

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #295 (Find Median from Data Stream)
Learn Design WhatsApp
tasks.description: Real-time messaging, group chats, delivery guarantees, WebSockets

days.title: Mock Interview #1 + Interview Prep
days.description: First full mock interview + prepare for real interviews

tasks.title: Full Mock Interview #1
tasks.description: 45 min: LeetCode Hard problem (timed) + 15 min: Behavioral questions
tasks.notes: Explain thinking aloud. Test with examples. Record yourself.

tasks.title: Practice System Design: Design Pinterest
tasks.description: Sketch feed generation, search, recommendations, media storage
tasks.notes: Focus on communication: features, data model, scalability

tasks.title: Submit 2 Applications + Interview Scheduling
tasks.description: Apply + schedule interviews if invites received
tasks.notes: Start scheduling real interviews this week

days.title: Mock Interview #2 + Behavioral Prep
days.description: Second mock interview and behavioral mastery

tasks.title: Full Mock Interview #2
tasks.description: 60 min: Two LeetCode mediums back-to-back (30 min each)
tasks.notes: Focus on: clean code, good variable names, edge cases

tasks.title: Practice All STAR Stories with Feedback
tasks.description: Deliver all 10+ stories. Get feedback from a friend.
tasks.notes: Are they compelling? Too long? Memorable? Natural delivery?

days.title: Week 6 Review & Interview Sprint Preparation
days.description: Review and prepare for interview weeks ahead

tasks.title: Redo 10 Hardest Problems from Scratch
tasks.description: Mix of all advanced topics. Test speed and understanding.
tasks.notes: You should solve these confidently and quickly now

tasks.title: Review All 5 System Designs
tasks.description: Sketch each from memory. Compare to reference.
tasks.notes: Be ready to design on the fly in interviews

tasks.title: Submit 3 Applications + Prep Schedule
tasks.description: Applications + organize interview schedule for next weeks
tasks.notes: You're interview-ready! Week 7-8 are interview focus weeks.

weeks.title: Week 7: Real Interview Week 1
weeks.description: Complete your first real interviews + maintain coding practice

days.title: Interview Week Mindset + Light Drill
days.description: Mental prep and warm-up problems

tasks.title: Mental Prep: Interview Confidence
tasks.description: You've solved 180+ problems. You're more prepared than 95% of candidates.
tasks.notes: Visualize success. Breathing exercises. Positive mindset.

tasks.title: Solve 5 Easy Problems at Interview Pace
tasks.description: Quick warm-up to get brain engaged
tasks.notes: Build momentum and confidence

tasks.title: Research First 2 Interview Companies
tasks.description: Tech stack, recent news, culture, interview format
tasks.notes: Know their product deeply. Be ready with questions.

days.title: Interview Day (or Practice Day)
days.description: First interview or continued practice

tasks.title: Pre-Interview: Light Warm-up
tasks.notes: Don't tire yourself. Just get warmed up.

tasks.title: Coding Interview (or Practice)
tasks.description: Explain thinking aloud. Test edge cases. Write clean code.
tasks.notes: After interview: debrief. What went well? What to improve?

tasks.title: Submit 2 Applications
tasks.description: Keep pipeline active. Don't overthink interview.

days.title: Interview Day (or Practice Day)
days.description: Second interview or continued practice

tasks.title: Light Warm-up (If Interview Day)
tasks.description: Easy problems or practice if no interview

tasks.title: Interview or Practice Session
tasks.description: If interview: crush it! If not: 4 medium problems.

days.title: System Design Interview (or Practice)
days.description: Design interview practice or real interview

tasks.title: Review Company Tech Stack (If Design Interview)
tasks.description: Know their infrastructure. Be ready to discuss tradeoffs.

tasks.title: Design Interview (or Practice Session)
tasks.description: Sketch solution. Discuss scalability. Ask clarifying questions.

days.title: Behavioral Interview (if applicable) + Refresh
days.description: Practice behavioral questions and stay sharp

tasks.title: Practice Behavioral Questions
tasks.description: Why us? Weaknesses? Failure? Leadership? Tell me about yourself.
tasks.notes: Authentic, specific STAR stories. Show genuine interest.

tasks.title: Solve 3 Medium Problems
tasks.description: Keep coding muscles warm between interviews

days.title: Interview Day (or More Practice)
days.description: Another interview or continued practice

tasks.title: Interview or Practice Session
tasks.description: Coding, design, or behavioral — depends on interview schedule
tasks.notes: Collect feedback from every interview. Stay positive.

days.title: Week 7 Review + Feedback & Preparation
days.description: Review interviews and prepare for week 8

tasks.title: Collect and Analyze Interview Feedback
tasks.description: What patterns emerge? Strengths? Areas to improve?
tasks.notes: Categorize: coding, communication, system design, behavioral

tasks.title: Light Practice: 5 Problems for Confidence
tasks.description: Solve problems you know well. Build momentum.

tasks.title: Submit 3 Applications + Prepare for Week 8
tasks.description: Applications + review schedule for remaining interviews
tasks.notes: You've done 3-5 interviews! Track responses and next steps.

weeks.title: Week 8: Real Interview Week 2
weeks.description: Continue real interviews + prepare for on-sites
goals: Complete 4-8 total interviews (mix of coding, design, behavioral)

days.title: Interview Refinement Based on Feedback
days.description: Improve based on week 7 feedback

tasks.title: Targeted Practice on Weak Areas
tasks.description: If you struggled with certain types of problems, deep dive on those
tasks.notes: Interview feedback is gold. Use it to improve.

tasks.title: Research 2 More Interview Companies
tasks.description: Prepare for upcoming interviews with detailed research

days.title: Interview Day
days.description: Another real interview

tasks.title: Coding/Design Interview
tasks.description: Apply what you learned from week 7 feedback
tasks.notes: You're getting better with each interview!

days.title: Interview Day
days.description: Another interview

days.title: System Design Focus Day
days.description: Design interview practice or real design interview

tasks.title: Practice 2 New System Designs
tasks.description: Pick designs you haven't practiced yet: Airbnb, Slack, Notification system
tasks.notes: Sketch quickly. Discuss tradeoffs. Show scalability thinking.

days.title: Interview Day
days.description: Another interview + behavioral prep

tasks.title: Interview (Coding, Design, or Behavioral)
tasks.description: Apply learnings. You're getting stronger each day!

days.title: Interview Day + On-Site Scheduling
days.description: Interview and schedule on-sites

tasks.title: Schedule On-Site Interviews
tasks.description: If you've passed phone screens, schedule on-sites for next week
tasks.notes: 2-3 on-sites is ideal for final push

days.title: Week 8 Review & On-Site Prep Sprint
days.description: Review week 8 and prepare for on-sites

tasks.title: Analyze All Interview Feedback
tasks.description: 6+ interviews now! Identify strongest areas and opportunities.
tasks.notes: You should see improvement trajectory by now

tasks.title: Light Coding Review: 5 Problems
tasks.description: Stay sharp. Pick problems you enjoyed.

tasks.title: Prepare for On-Sites
tasks.description: Research each company deeply. Prepare thoughtful questions.
tasks.notes: On-sites are final step before offers. You're almost there!

weeks.title: Week 9: On-Sites, Offers & Negotiations
weeks.description: Final on-site interviews, offer collection, negotiation, and onboarding prep
goals: Prepare for first day at new company

days.title: On-Site Prep Sprint
days.description: Final preparation for on-site interview

tasks.title: Deep Company Research
tasks.description: Team structure, projects, engineers, interview panel members if known
tasks.notes: Personalize questions for each interviewer

tasks.title: Solve 5 Medium-Hard Problems
tasks.notes: Quick, confident solutions

tasks.title: Practice Full Intro & STAR Stories
tasks.notes: Natural, confident delivery

days.title: On-Site Day 1
days.description: First on-site interview (if scheduled)

tasks.title: Final 5-Problem Warm-up
tasks.description: Easy problems. Get brain engaged. Build confidence.
tasks.notes: Trust yourself. You've prepared for this.

tasks.title: On-Site Interview
tasks.description: You've solved 180+ problems. Ace this final round!
tasks.notes: Be authentic. Ask good questions. Show genuine interest.

tasks.title: Debrief & Take Notes
tasks.description: Immediately after: write what was asked, how you answered, feedback hints
tasks.notes: Send thank-you notes within 24 hours

days.title: On-Site Day 2 (if applicable) + Offers Start Coming
days.description: Second on-site and begin collecting offers

tasks.title: Warm-up (if on-site day 2) or Light Practice
tasks.description: If on-site: 5 easy problems. If not: review week learnings.

tasks.title: On-Site Interview (if scheduled)
tasks.notes: Each interview is a learning opportunity

tasks.title: Send Thank-You Notes
tasks.description: Personalized emails within 24 hours of interviews
tasks.notes: Reference specific discussion points. Show genuine interest.

days.title: Offer Collection & Comparison
days.description: Gather offers and compare terms

tasks.title: Create Offer Comparison Spreadsheet
tasks.description: Base salary, signing bonus, RSU, benefits, PTO, growth, culture, location, team
tasks.notes: Don't just compare base. Look at total compensation over 4 years.

tasks.title: Prepare Negotiation Strategy
tasks.description: Research market rates. Know your minimum acceptable salary.
tasks.notes: Never accept first offer. Always negotiate professionally.

tasks.title: Write Negotiation Talking Points
tasks.description: Value proposition, competing offers, market data, unique skills

days.title: Active Negotiations
days.description: Negotiate with each company

tasks.title: Negotiate with Company 1
tasks.description: Call or email with specific ask. Data-driven, professional, firm.
tasks.notes: Target: 10-20% above initial offer if possible

tasks.title: Get Everything in Writing
tasks.description: Request updated offer letters with negotiated terms
tasks.notes: Check: start date, equity vesting, signing bonus timing, relocation

days.title: Final Decision & Job Acceptance
days.description: Make final decision and accept offer

tasks.title: Talk to Mentors/Friends
tasks.description: Get perspective on your top choices
tasks.notes: Career impact, growth, culture, personal fulfillment

tasks.title: Make Final Decision
tasks.description: Trust your gut. Accept your top choice.
tasks.notes: Once decided, don't second-guess!

tasks.title: Accept Offer + Decline Others
tasks.description: Accept in writing. Professionally decline with gratitude.
tasks.notes: Declining professionally keeps doors open for future.

days.title: Onboarding Prep & Celebration
days.description: Prepare for first day and celebrate your achievement

tasks.title: Give Notice at Current Job (if employed)
tasks.notes: Be gracious. Maintain relationships.

tasks.title: Research New Company Deep Dive
tasks.description: Explore GitHub, engineering blog, tech talks, codebase if public
tasks.notes: Understand: tech stack, architecture patterns, coding standards

tasks.title: Celebrate Your Achievement! 🎉
tasks.description: JOB OFFER ACCEPTED! You did it! Rest, celebrate with family/friends.
tasks.notes: You completed an intensive 9-week job search. That's incredible! You earned this.
